commit_message:
Add spec for deploying OS tarballs

This spec describes steps involved in adding
support for deploying OS tarballs using ironic's
agent driver.

Partial-bug: #1526767

Change-Id: I2dd4d65f3233e774c33b0aa7807622b283311bee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/68/248968/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========== Tar Payload =========== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/tar-payload The agent driver only support whole disk images that can be deployed to baremetal. Partition image support was proposed to agent driver and it is in backlog. With tar payload support operators can deploy OS tarballs with agent driver. Problem description =================== Ironic python agent supports deploying OS as whole disk images and partition images. Modern installers like anaconda support deploying tarballs to the disk. Tarballs are easy to create and faster deploy. This feature will let operators upload OS tarballs to glance and deploy it to barmetal using agent driver. Proposed change =============== * Agent driver inspects the image to find if it is a partition image or a whole disk image or a tarball. * If it is a tarball agent driver sends "default" partition info (root, swap, etc) through image_info to agent ramdisk. * Upon receiving the partition information, agent ramdisk will partition and format the os_install disk and extract the tarball on to it. * The tarball extraction will preserve acls and extended filesystem attributes. * Once the tarball is extracted, agent ramdisk will generate a host-only ramdisk and install the bootloader to the MBR of the os_install disk. * Factor out the partitioning code from ironic into a different library and use it in both IPA and ironic code base.

commit_message:
Propose ISC-DHCPD Driver for Neutron DHCP Agent

This Devref is a proposal to add support for ISC-DHCPD driver
for Neutron DHCP Agent.
Related-bug: #1464793

Change-Id: I0f109d84bab067af9e6baea4ac918d8bd6d0a6c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/36/212836/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================= ISC-DHCPD Driver for Neutron DHCP Agent ======================================= Currently, Neutron's dhcp agent only supports Dnsmasq. Dnsmasq has a very serious limitation that, it needs a reload any time when hosts, opts or addn hosts configs are updated. According to this `Dnsmasq performance blog <https://www.mirantis.com/blog/improving-dhcp-performance-openstack/>`_ , this can take unto 4 minutes with 65535 static leases. When we consider use-cases like Baremetal Deployments (Ironic), where thousands of baremetal nodes may need to be booted at a time, Dnsmasq poses serious scaling limitations. Things get even worse when a cloud provider wants their DHCP Server to handle all the networks in the datacenter (traditional use-case), as against having separate DHCP Server per network. Typical industry standard is to use `ISC-DHCPD <https://www.isc.org/downloads/dhcp/>`_ instead of Dnsmasq. In general ISC-DHCPD has lot more features than Dnsmasq. It also supports OMAPI, which allows creating/deleting and updating host or lease objects runtime. There are two ways to use OMAPI: `omshell <http://linux.die.net/man/1/omshell>`_ and `PyPureOmapi python library <https://github.com/CygnusNetworks/pypureomapi>`_ With OMAPI, its very easy to selectively add/delete a host/lease from configuration (as against updating full config on every create/update port) Considering that most of the industry uses isc-dhcpd, this will be a great addition to OpenStack neutron.

commit_message:
Remove 'agent_last_heartbeat' from node.driver_internal_info

node.driver_internal_info['agent_last_heartbeat'] was not being used by
ironic, and Ic198f6a952ed135099bcc525ef548a4aea005056 removed the code
that sets that value.

However, for existing nodes, driver_internal_info['agent_last_heartbeat']
may already exist, so we need to delete it. This patch does that.

In addition, a LOG line was moved (and a nit addressed) to make the code
a bit easier to read.

This is a followup to Ic198f6a952ed135099bcc525ef548a4aea005056.

Change-Id: I194d22c0e605b187823ceebae94d3ef895fb91f5
Related-Bug: #1602410
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/52/387652/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('Heartbeat from node %s', node.uuid) # TODO(rloo): 'agent_last_heartbeat' was deprecated since it wasn't # being used so remove that entry if it exists. # Hopefully all nodes will have been updated by Pike, so # we can delete this code then. driver_internal_info.pop('agent_last_heartbeat', None)

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn into LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3, use logging.warning instead.
Because of the change is too much, divided into two times to submit.
The same patch is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/376339/,
and this is last patch. All of project have been modified.

related link:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

Change-Id: I42824f8bbce7fbfcd034f5351b2c58954455a5b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/73/376373/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: LOG.warn(_LW("One or more image locations couldn't be scrubbed " "from backend. Leaving image '%s' in 'pending_delete'" " status") % image_id)

commit_message:
API support to cluster_get2

This adds cluster_get new version which passes a versioned object for
the RPC request.

Change-Id: I0ee95e4853c7b6effe3f51f866c2da5d186ff626
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/12/387912/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_get2(self, mock_enforce): cfg.CONF.set_override('rpc_use_object', True, enforce_type=True) self._mock_enforce_setup(mock_enforce, 'get', True) cid = 'cid' req = self._get('/clusters/%s' % cid) engine_resp = {'foo': 'bar'} mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2', return_value=engine_resp) response = self.controller.get(req, cluster_id=cid) mock_call.assert_called_once_with(req.context, 'cluster_get2', mock.ANY) expected = {'cluster': engine_resp} self.assertEqual(expected, response) request = mock_call.call_args[0][2] self.assertEqual('cid', request.identity) def test_get2_not_found(self, mock_enforce): cfg.CONF.set_override('rpc_use_object', True, enforce_type=True) self._mock_enforce_setup(mock_enforce, 'get', True) cid = 'non-existent-cluster' req = self._get('/clusters/%s' % cid) error = senlin_exc.ResourceNotFound(type='cluster', id=cid) mock_call = self.patchobject(rpc_client.EngineClient, 'call2') mock_call.side_effect = shared.to_remote_error(error) resp = shared.request_with_middleware(fault.FaultWrapper, self.controller.get, req, cluster_id=cid) self.assertEqual(404, resp.json['code']) self.assertEqual('ResourceNotFound', resp.json['error']['type']) def test_get2_denied_policy(self, mock_enforce): cfg.CONF.set_override('rpc_use_object', True, enforce_type=True) self._mock_enforce_setup(mock_enforce, 'get', False) cid = 'cid' req = self._get('/clusters/%s' % cid) resp = shared.request_with_middleware(fault.FaultWrapper, self.controller.get, req, cluster_id=cid) self.assertEqual(403, resp.status_int) self.assertIn('403 Forbidden', six.text_type(resp))

Fix LOG.warn to LOG.warning

logging.warn is deprecated in Python 3.
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

commit_message:
Correct logging translation markers

There were a few log strings that were not using the appropriate
translation marker for their given log level.

Also fixed a couple cases of passing in an exception to a LOG.exception
call. LOG.exception will automatically log whatever exception is in
scope, so switched these to be the equivalent LOG.error levels so the
exceptions do not get logged twice.

Change-Id: If1be4661174dfcf30567b5093bd5373c2c275cf5

commit_message:
Prevent ssync writing bad fragment data to diskfile

Previously, if a reconstructor sync type job failed to provide
sufficient bytes from a reconstructed fragment body iterator to match
the content-length that the ssync sender had already sent to the ssync
receiver, the sender would still proceed to send the next
subrequest. The ssync receiver might then write the start of the next
subrequest to the partially complete diskfile for the previous
subrequest (including writing subrequest headers to that diskfile)
until it has received content-length bytes.

Since a reconstructor ssync job does not send an ETag header (it
cannot because it does not know the ETag of a reconstructed fragment
until it has been sent) then the receiving object server does not
detect the "bad" data written to the fragment diskfile, and worse,
will label it with an ETag that matches the md5 sum of the bad
data. The bad fragment file will therefore appear good to the auditor.

There is no easy way for the ssync sender to communicate a lack of
source data to the receiver other than by disconnecting the
session. So this patch adds a check in the ssync sender that the sent
byte count is equal to the sent Content-Length header value for each
subrequest, and disconnect if a mismatch is detected.

The disconnect prevents the receiver finalizing the bad diskfile, but
also prevents subsequent fragments in the ssync job being sync'd until
the next cycle.

N.B.
Though this is a backport patch to 2.7.0 release, there is the
difference from the original commit
3218f8b064e462d901466b04a4813e15ec96da85 on the master branch which is
the number of eventlet trampoline sleeps to make before asserting the
written log in test/unit/obj/test_ssync.py. That is because in 2.7.0
there is an extra eventlet coro for writing chunks into the real
diskfile, which was subsequently removed with commit
4c11833a9cbff499725365e535e217f3eae3c442 during the 2.7.0-2.8.0
development cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1631144
Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Change-Id: I54068906efdb9cd58fcdc6eae7c2163ea92afb9d

commit_message:
Use ConfigParser instead of SafeConfigParser

The SafeConfigParser class has been renamed to ConfigParser in Python
3.2 [1]. This alias will be removed in future versions.So we can use
ConfigParser directly instead.

[1] http://bugs.python.org/issue10627

Change-Id: I8cc3bcde108916bda6b8ac95cae9abefe3b5cdee
Closes-Bug: #1618666

commit_message:
Temporary fix for pycparser

pycparser-2.15 is breaking the CI, specify the version to avoid the problem.
This change should be reverted after the fix of pycparser.

Change-Id: I8b4c133291f1b68fad83538d0ab7f1f653840eb2

commit_message:
Fixed NoneType issue when monitoring-environment.yaml

When you tried to use the environemnt/monitoring-environment.yaml
as a part of the deployment on the overcloud you hit the
following error and it stops the deploy of the overcloud.

***
Deploying templates in the directory /home/stack/tripleo-heat-templates
'NoneType' object does not support item assignment
***

Closes-Bug: #1629323
Change-Id: I8cf2e7d8f3a4e79cc71a1566ec17d0a977c38d60
Signed-off-by: Juan Badia Payno <jbadiapa@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adding Timing metrics for DRAC drivers.

This change adds timing metrics for method in the bios, deploy, inspect, management,
power, raid, vendor_passthru modules

Change-Id: Ib301f203badecf4834dae5bba35175d13c4545cf
Closes-Bug: #1611555

commit_message:
fix panko initialisation

i accidentally mucked up the fact that gnocchi plugin is the start
of setting DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG value. this patch just moves gnocchi
to start since it doesn't matter if gnocchi or panko is started first.

Change-Id: I33a3f1a1b6e58be4aa6e02e2f5f1e2cb3c08bf21

commit_message:
start panko before ceilometer

panko needs to be installed and running before ceilometer to ensure
ceilometer has a valid target to send to.

Change-Id: I90c238f790226d70f0bef4a684cf53b6b4a58bda
Closes-Bug: #1633592

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-19 20:23:51.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ceilometer.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/c2d063bc15ff1367e846813b6ef76e26318d7109', 'message': "fix ceilometer integration job to handle slow gate

ceilometer tries to connect to gnocchi when started. a retry mechanism
is in place if gnocchi is unavailable. on a slow gate, the retry
limit is hit before gnocchi is started so ceilometer abandons its
attempt to connect and resulting checks fail as no data is recorded.

this patch changes it so gnocchi is started first to ensure it's ready

"}]
commit_message:
fix ceilometer integration job to handle slow gate

ceilometer tries to connect to gnocchi when started. a retry mechanism
is in place if gnocchi is unavailable. on a slow gate, the retry
limit is hit before gnocchi is started so ceilometer abandons its
attempt to connect and resulting checks fail as no data is recorded.

this patch changes it so gnocchi is started first to ensure it's ready
when ceilometer attempts to connect to it.

Change-Id: I77bc50235222422e5a0f7b6797ae0ed8640a3495
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/46/269846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove broken service enablement for ceilometer

It's ENABLED_SERVICE, so these are completely unused.
Remove the values, the defaults work just fine, this is not needed
anymore.

Closes-Bug: #1607636

commit_message:
Fix broken rabbitmqctl commands when using ipv6

When deploying via ipv6, rabbitmq-ctl commands have the following
issues:

- `rabbitmq cluster_status` shows nodedown alerts
- list_queues / list_connections hang
- `rabbitmqctl node_health_check` fails with an error.

* There is no any issue while performing activity on RHOS setup(From
* horizon/cli). i.e. RHOS environment is functioning as expected.

For example:
sudo rabbitmqctl node_health_check -n rabbit@node1
Checking health of node 'rabbit@node1' ...
Heath check failed:
health check of node 'rabbit@node1' fails: nodedown

The problem is that we are missing the following in
/etc/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-env.conf:
RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS="-proto_dist inet6_tcp"

Fix these by setting the appropriate RABBITMQ_CTL_ERL_ARGS when
deploying ipv6.

Closes-Bug: #1633693
Change-Id: I53f4e76e687b3966fbb74fd0c2d83f05176630de

commit_message:
Add entry_point for oslo policy scripts

There are two helper scripts in oslo.policy to help deployers understand
their policy configuration better. With the setup.cfg entry these can be
called directly from oslo.policy.

Change-Id: Icfff952f0742b188968603cd3335a3ef50965337
Closes-Bug: #1625804
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/62/380962/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Ironic is now configured to work with two oslo.policy CLI scripts that have been added. The first of these can be called like "oslopolicy-list-redundant --namespace ironic" and will output a list of policy rules in policy.[json|yaml] that match the project defaults. These rules can be removed from the policy file as they have no effect there. The second script can be called like "oslopolicy-policy-generator --namespace ironic --output-file policy-merged.yaml" and will populate the policy-merged.yaml file with the effective policy. This is the merged results of project defaults and config file overrides.

commit_message:
Fixing issue with dry_run

Dry_run command broke after the send_init_req call was deleted.
This patch fixes it; Now a parameter is used to check in
send_init_req if the call is from dry_run and if it is,
no request is send, in all other cases the prepared request is
sent and the resulting response is parsed.

Change-Id: I58e703d55abff06ebe0a35efaf1801c554e9382b
Fixes-Bug: #1632891
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/syntribos refs/changes/98/385698/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Set memcached_servers for nova API

This patch updates the Nova profile so that we set memcached
servers correctly for the Nova keystone auth_token middleware.

Most of the hiera settings for ::nova::keystone::authtoken are
already included in the t-h-t nova-api service.

Change-Id: I3b7ff02abbd0d5e0c38232d02b33e4c7bc411120
Closes-bug: #1633595
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/24/387624/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hiera('nova::use_ipv6', false) { $memcache_servers = suffix(hiera('memcached_node_ips_v6'), ':11211') } else { $memcache_servers = suffix(hiera('memcached_node_ips'), ':11211') } class { '::nova::keystone::authtoken': memcached_servers => $memcache_servers }

commit_message:
Save the result of direct action calls in Mistral

Mistral now allows us to run actions synchronously and have the result
be saved. This is useful for audit purposes as direct action calls will
now show up in `mistal action-execution-list`.

Closes-Bug: #1631281
Depends-On: I00c6301394512e123436ca6c5650827c2475308e
Change-Id: I4d5167d5fea5e75ae7246d1e92537489fc9a6f1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/39/381739/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: result = workflow_client.action_executions.create( action, input_, save_result=True, run_sync=True)

commit_message:
Switch mistral api to use os_workers

When not runing mistral under apache, we should use os_workers for the
number of workers to run by default. This change updates the api
configuration to use os_workers which is the larger of
(number of cpus/4) or 2 but is capped at 8.

Change-Id: I9ddb72c0424cfda539fcddf3c67f8f4b729a7ccb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-mistral refs/changes/91/386691/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- other: - Switched default api worker count for the api service when not run under apache to use os_workers.

commit_message:
allow PATH_TROVE to be specified by gate or defaulted by trovestack

When run as redstack, which was in a different repository, PATH_TROVE
could be set as $DEST/trove unambiguously. However, now that
trovestack is in the trove repository, this is no longer the case. The
gate will have trove in a different location than the rest of the
repositories that get cloned.

Therefore we have to handle this situation by defaulting PATH_TROVE to
be based on the location of trovestack with the option to override.

Also use a better way to find TROVESTACK_SCRIPTS (than pwd).

Change-Id: Ic788c772017fbb410ce65939c90986e2d400e36d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/13/388113/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Enable object versioning in Swift proxy

Tempest expects object versioning to be enabled by default in Swift;
if not it has to be disabled explicitly in the Tempest config.

This is a commonly used middleware, therefore it should be enabled
in the overcloud proxy nodes as well.

Closes-Bug: 1632215
Depends-On: I07a206473ff7939749e3eba1dfe3ea8c4526eb5c
Change-Id: I4eae08ff3f9a3a2f829c3497c1c2aaee8e7f8554
(cherry picked from commit 28a2a6d56b5415a4d354c56dc70bc036d109601d)

commit_message:
Make os-refresh-config element package driven

This removes the source driven install paths.

99-refresh-completed is still installed by this element. Eventually it
should be packaged to simplify in-place upgrades.

Change-Id: I24cb6ac21849065c0e91f1f1e7fc7923010754fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/05/366405/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash # We need to install this early in install.d because other elements will # need to use os-refresh-config --print-base to know where to put files set -eux manifest=$(get-pip-manifest os-refresh-config) # pip and virtualenv is installed by the pip-and-virtualenv element virtualenv --setuptools /opt/stack/venvs/os-refresh-config set +u source /opt/stack/venvs/os-refresh-config/bin/activate set -u if [ -n "$manifest" ]; then use-pip-manifest $manifest else # Need setuptools>=1.0 to manage connections when # downloading from pypi using http_proxy and https_proxy /opt/stack/venvs/os-refresh-config/bin/pip install -U pip /opt/stack/venvs/os-refresh-config/bin/pip install -U 'setuptools>=1.0' # bug #1293812 : Avoid easy_install triggering on pbr. /opt/stack/venvs/os-refresh-config/bin/pip install -U 'pbr>=0.11,<2.0' /opt/stack/venvs/os-refresh-config/bin/pip install -U os-refresh-config fi # Write the manifest of what was installed write-pip-manifest os-refresh-config ln -s /opt/stack/venvs/os-refresh-config/bin/os-refresh-config /usr/local/bin/os-refresh-config for d in pre-configure.d configure.d migration.d post-configure.d; do install -m 0755 -o root -g root -d $(os-refresh-config --print-base)/$d done set +u deactivate set -u

commit_message:
Make os-apply-config package driven

Due to rdo packaging changes this element can be simplified to
installing packages and installing os-apply-config templates
contributed by other elements.

Packaging changes which make this possible are:
- 20-os-apply-config now installed by python-heat-agent
- os-apply-config package now creates the template root directory

Change-Id: I5c97cf2409272666371997f19b2871ae12ff5149

commit_message:
Make os-collect-config element package driven

The package python-heat-agent now takes care of the os-collect-config
bootstrap files, so this element can devolve into installing
python-heat-agent and enabling the os-collect-config service.

This change also needs to fix 99-install-config-templates when there
is no os-apply-config templates to install.

Change-Id: Ida66a236ae9f123cf4b6d6ba7122a142b4d04d4e

With this change, any Stack object loaded via Stack._from_db_object
will end up memoized in a context cache keyed by the stack ID.

This cache will only be looked up if refresh=False is specified in
Stack.get_by_id. Any calls which write stack data to the database will
invalidate the context cache for that stack.

Currently only the stack-resource loading specifies refresh=False to
support prefetching of nested stacks for bug #1578854.

Change-Id: Ic7859b71cbf95d0c253fac69836ad5c004b84c29
Partial-Bug: #1578854

added_lines: import org.apache.commons.codec.digest.DigestUtils; import monasca.persister.repository.Sha1HashId; StringBuilder definitionDimensionsIdStringToHash = new StringBuilder(); definitionDimensionsIdStringToHash.append(name); definitionDimensionsIdStringToHash.append(value); } String tenantId = definition.getTenantId(); String region = definition.getRegion(); tagMap.put("_tenant_id", tenantId); tagMap.put("_region", region); definitionDimensionsIdStringToHash.append(tenantId); definitionDimensionsIdStringToHash.append(region); byte[] definitionDimensionsIdSha1Hash = DigestUtils.sha(definitionDimensionsIdStringToHash.toString()); Sha1HashId definitionDimensionsSha1HashId = new Sha1HashId(definitionDimensionsIdSha1Hash); tagMap.put("_definition_dimension_id", definitionDimensionsSha1HashId.toHexString());

commit_message:
Fix neutron-lbaas and octavia PROJECTS list

This change [1] removed diskimage-builder from the default list of
projects for devstack.  This patch adds the required projects to
the list for neutron-lbaas and octavia gate jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/345818

Change-Id: Ie73bbc1ea8ecfb88566f3fd6a5e89d7704c973fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/46/388246/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export PROJECTS="openstack/diskimage-builder $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/tripleo-image-elements $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/neutron-lbaas $PROJECTS" export PROJECTS="openstack/octavia $PROJECTS"

commit_message:
WIP An svg chart event list formatter

"openstack stack event list --format chart" will write out valid SVG
which shows all events in a gantt chart style.

Events for nested stacks are rendered correctly and grouped with the
event for the parent stack.

Events for failed resources are rendered in a different color to other
resources.

Change-Id: Ic63c2f2b0216c7a50440b411f939c46d25e9dfca

subject: Remove unnecessary 'processorcount' facts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-07 13:41:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon/commit/2a18a5a0d7d3703eba03d28fdbb9f5057f3e6c22', 'message': '[WIP]Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Ic4aaf6be4b44b8799a29a44a063614071d1372a4
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-10 10:58:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon/commit/ea5dcbc1eb7b29622fde580eb857da5370140308', 'message': 'Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary 'processorcount' facts

It removes unnecessary 'processorcount' facts in the tests
as os_workers fact should be used instead 'processorcount'.

Change-Id: Ic4aaf6be4b44b8799a29a44a063614071d1372a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/41/383741/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixes for check-uc jenkins job

Implement XFAIL handling for ignoring known problems so that
we can make the job voting until the remaining issues are sorted
out.

(XFAIL list reduced to what matters in stable/newton)

Change-Id: Ia2cf2c440a72e6365a9ff08086704dc535bbc072
(cherry picked from commit d59c8ece29cb785096ef4ff62683d3e9551a125f)

commit_message:
Remove reference to removed metric types

Removing references to histogram and set types.

Converting timer data from histogram type to gauge.

Enabling tox jobs because I was depending on them to tell me if I screwed
something up.

Change-Id: If9fbbf655baca67e7f205e4493c0929ac90d386a
(cherry picked from commit c4bbfa665df15e57b73381b2467e214c4e04a70a)

commit_message:
Fix unnecessary bullet point

There are some place being displayed unnecessary bullet point.
 - Error message in login page (This ticket has a screenshot).
   There is no need to use 'ul'.
 - The row of 'No users/groups' in Project Member/Group tab in
   Create/Update Project modal.
 - The row of 'No projects found' in Flavor Access tab in
   Edit Flavor modal.
   There are same structure as a membership. So it needs to
   add a nav class.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I3f906808a53807ebd8c0d6a342b0219383776e91
Closes-bug: #1617262
(cherry picked from commit 88878488541befe786c60219988b06180117cf76)

commit_message:
Split out hosts config deployment

This patch moves the hosts configuration into its own deployment.
It will continue to use os-apply-config as something that is
required early on in the bootstrapping (it needs to be
configured before puppet runs for example).

The motivation here is so we can refactor all-nodes-config.yaml to use a
new hiera hook that that avoids os-apply-config entirely.

Change-Id: Ib3e4380f205358b27d22a1102b663cf300b1ed86
Partial-bug: #1596373

subject: Allow overriding CLI parameter defaults with env files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 10:39:16.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/utils.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/0b2984f687c4377b7367cfaf7f72a25a9bfbb6bd', 'message': "Allow overriding CLI parameter defaults with env files

We've added the ability to override CLI defaults with environment files
[1] but then it got reversed while fixing a related bug [2]. We need to
put this ability back because otherwise we cannot customize
e.g. NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork, or deploy with external Ceph with
custom FSID and key.

As a related change we have to remove hardcoded role counts from
overcloud-env.json, because they'd overwrite the counts passed via
CLI. (Furthermore, having the hardcoded default counts there doesn't
make too much sense now that we have custom roles, the counts should
already be properly defaulted in role_data.yaml.)

[1] Change ID I2722e118abde1cea6210148b16ac1ed3d9f235d8
[2] Change ID I80c663c23dfa27fa7b4ca2bf6b0101c132e5889b

Change-Id: Iaf0adda44c84fcc552e743e4712d1dcf01daa7e4
(cherry picked from commit 71ebf2a31ecaee96342599c2d14ee5325d6d6413)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow overriding CLI parameter defaults with env files

We've added the ability to override CLI defaults with environment files
[1] but then it got reversed while fixing a related bug [2]. We need to
put this ability back because otherwise we cannot customize
e.g. NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork, or deploy with external Ceph with
custom FSID and key.

As a related change we have to remove hardcoded role counts from
overcloud-env.json, because they'd overwrite the counts passed via
CLI. (Furthermore, having the hardcoded default counts there doesn't
make too much sense now that we have custom roles, the counts should
already be properly defaulted in role_data.yaml.)

[1] Change ID I2722e118abde1cea6210148b16ac1ed3d9f235d8
[2] Change ID I80c663c23dfa27fa7b4ca2bf6b0101c132e5889b

Closes-Bug: #1632683
Change-Id: Iaf0adda44c84fcc552e743e4712d1dcf01daa7e4
(cherry picked from commit 71ebf2a31ecaee96342599c2d14ee5325d6d6413)

how both Sandbox git repository and Launchpad is used
with illustrative screenshots.

subject: Add missing options for HTTPClient if auth_token given.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 04:41:28.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/tests/v1/test_client.py', 'magnumclient/v1/client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/14dfc7d61664b03d2b7bed74dd032c60a0d86a19', 'message': 'Add missing options for HTTPClient if auth_token given.

The insecure client options and timeout were bypassed
if auth token was given, as in case of Magnum UI.
This is causing SSL error even insecure is set to true
by Magnum UI and magnum client is unable to skip SSL check
becuase insecure option was not passed to HTTPClient.
This was caused due to this change :
https://github.com/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/a374b9f99cabd78f93603860425517d45b6290fa#diff-c8d8ebbd1f15e85c914906c6357e0a5f
As a consequence, any HTTPS based connections to magnum endpoint
fail. With this patch, the missing options to HTTPClient are
correctly passed to and SSL checks are skipped safely if insecure
is set to True.

Change-Id: I885301d6eb69182f109cdfbfbc771bbbf13beb2a
Closes-Bug: #1634305
(cherry picked from commit 7829c8c901da4cb0e6dd821ca0127ddc93e75442)
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing options for HTTPClient if auth_token given.

The insecure client options and timeout were bypassed
if auth token was given, as in case of Magnum UI.
This is causing SSL error even insecure is set to true
by Magnum UI and magnum client is unable to skip SSL check
becuase insecure option was not passed to HTTPClient.
This was caused due to this change :
https://github.com/openstack/python-magnumclient/commit/a374b9f99cabd78f93603860425517d45b6290fa#diff-c8d8ebbd1f15e85c914906c6357e0a5f
As a consequence, any HTTPS based connections to magnum endpoint
fail. With this patch, the missing options to HTTPClient are
correctly passed to and SSL checks are skipped safely if insecure
is set to True.

Change-Id: I885301d6eb69182f109cdfbfbc771bbbf13beb2a
Closes-Bug: #1634305
(cherry picked from commit 7829c8c901da4cb0e6dd821ca0127ddc93e75442)

commit_message:
heat-api-cfn endpoint is created to RegionOne instead of regionOne

When deploying, heat-api-cfn is assigned to RegionOne. This leads to a
bad user experience when logging into horizon, because if RegionOne is
selected by default, the users finds all menus empty (no computing, or
anything else).

Thanks to trown for finding out the issue.

Closes-Bug: 1633524

Change-Id: Ic108280f6b0875ffec10be6f696669962fb82e6b
(cherry picked from commit 74317f2b966d6c91150cb33666be7d15e2b31ffe)

commit_message:
rename py27-with-upper-constraints to py27-check-uc

Due to the rename of the job adding the -ubuntu-trusty suffix,
we have exceeded the path limit and can no longer run inside the
tox environment. shortening to a shorter check name (and renaming
the job) should fix this.

commit_message:
Refresh DeployIdentifier as well on update

The package update was not refreshing the DeployIdentifier, so puppet
was never actually running. This adds the DeployIdentifier to the
heat update call.

Change-Id: I102c935e618e822c41e1201cdbb8e243ff8421af
Depends-On: I1be83f88be1959885c980ab4f428477d412751f7
Closes-Bug: #1522943
(cherry picked from commit 63f926d8a0b5c7b6e952c7023fbacf687bb03645)

subject: Tune number of workers for undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 15:10:31.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud/commit/a7c0f152a6f463429aca557684cadf6c51ab06d1', 'message': 'Tune number of workers for undercloud

By default many services use the number of cpus as the default number of
workers.  On baremetal systems this can lead to excessive RAM
comsumption as this can be 16, 32, 48 or higher for each of the
services. In the upstream puppet openstack, a fact was created as part
of the Newton cycle that is the larger value between (number of cpus/4)
or 2 but is capped at 8. These defaults have not been updated yet in the
upstream modules and it would be better to specifically call out the
worker configurations in our puppet-stack-config.yaml template.

This change updates the worker settings for the classes that are pulled
in for the undercloud to leverage this tuned fact to lower the overall
number of workers for all the services.  This should improve memory
consumption and reduce the number of processes running on baremetal
systems. The os_workers fact will be 2 for unless the cpu count is
greater than 8 with an incremental increase of 1 worker for every 4
processors until 32 processors.  Anything above 32 processors will still
result in a worker value of 8.

This change updates 17 services that currently may use the number of
processors for the default number of workers.

Change-Id: I9ed855648e23b0a7e452e6a840a92779fa3f6d48
Closes-Bug: #1633544
(cherry picked from commit ee5f25a726910961caf72de2c6c55de06c922b74)
'}]
commit_message:
Tune number of workers for undercloud

By default many services use the number of cpus as the default number of
workers.  On baremetal systems this can lead to excessive RAM
comsumption as this can be 16, 32, 48 or higher for each of the
services. In the upstream puppet openstack, a fact was created as part
of the Newton cycle that is the larger value between (number of cpus/4)
or 2 but is capped at 8. These defaults have not been updated yet in the
upstream modules and it would be better to specifically call out the
worker configurations in our puppet-stack-config.yaml template.

This change updates the worker settings for the classes that are pulled
in for the undercloud to leverage this tuned fact to lower the overall
number of workers for all the services.  This should improve memory
consumption and reduce the number of processes running on baremetal
systems. The os_workers fact will be 2 for unless the cpu count is
greater than 8 with an incremental increase of 1 worker for every 4
processors until 32 processors.  Anything above 32 processors will still
result in a worker value of 8.

This change updates 17 services that currently may use the number of
processors for the default number of workers.

Change-Id: I9ed855648e23b0a7e452e6a840a92779fa3f6d48
Closes-Bug: #1633544
(cherry picked from commit ee5f25a726910961caf72de2c6c55de06c922b74)

commit_message:
Only create the Mistral config env if it doesn't exist

From I71edae4a4dee2204edf32e3b2800f075d221b856 we started to create a
Mistral env in instack-undercloud. This happens at install time. We
failed to only do this if the environment doesn't exist, at the moment
instack will fail on a second undercloud install as Mistral will attempt
to create the environment again and raise an exception.

This patch also fixes a regression introduced by
I71edae4a4dee2204edf32e3b2800f075d221b856 which created the config
env *after* creating the default plan - given the default plan creation
depends on the environment, this was an error.

Closes-Bug: #1633450
Change-Id: I186217fd0e1125519149763e610d3efdff583388

commit_message:
Run ceilometer api under wsgi on undercloud

When we have enable telemetry true we currently run api as
eventlet process. This is fine for small use cases, but it
would be useful to migrate to wsgi to be consistent with
overcloud.

Change-Id: Ib0fe36fe6cef4afefd7ab63f64922b6943fe90ab
(cherry picked from commit 7c24207563085620c4fef32eab76cec56e9c98cb)

installed at all if installing in a venv.

commit_message:
Docker compute, use role based config.

The file puppet/manifests/overcloud_compute.pp no longer exists, so
the docker compute-post needs to switch over to the common role
manifest as per I79da0f523189959b783bbcbb3b0f37be778e02fe

Note that due to bug #1634260 the missing overcloud_compute.pp was
ignored and a non docker overcloud was deployed.

Change-Id: I7d7cbea4ef56634a97b62cdbdb0bc9d2aba7448e

commit_message:
make client cache region aware

The client cache does not take into account changes
to the public variable 'region_name' on the client
manager. This is a design flaw. This minor change
fixes that problem by caching the client per
region.

Change-Id: I6d97045921d36500e34fe43cd688b7d846533ec4

commit_message:
Source deploy.env in tripleo.sh

When running multinode jobs, we need to make sure deploy.env is sourced
everytime tripleo.sh is run. The easiest way to do this is to source it
at the beginning of tripleo.sh if the file exists in the expected
location where it would be created by tripleo-ci.

We then need to pass the value over ssh when we ssh to subnodes to run
commands.

Change-Id: I01bf15b3c689b4fd0cdd848cf264dd9794e1d828
Closes-Bug: #1634319
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/50/387750/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Source deploy.env if it exists. It should exist if we are running under # tripleo-ci if [ -f "$TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/deploy.env" ]; then source $TRIPLEO_ROOT/tripleo-ci/deploy.env fi

commit_message:
Added section on security review

Change-Id: I80576d9b3d13f9b2a4c203e735ef4b5f54ef3641
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/security-doc refs/changes/53/356153/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======================================= Objectives for Security Threat Analysis ======================================= We assert that after a Threat Analysis we: - Know all entry points into a system - Know what assets are at risk - Know where data is persisted - Understand how data travels between components of the system - Understand data formats and transformations - Document external dependencies - Identified who we are (and are not) protecting against - Understand the impact of degrading controls - Have a list of agreed defects

commit_message:
Filtering by visibility in image table does not work

In the filtering form in the Image table (in both project and admin
image panel), when 'visibility' filter is selected, "Error: Unable to
retrieve the images." is returned. This occurs regardless of selected
visibility value. This patch will prevent looking in the dictionary
with an invalid value and fix the problem.

Change-Id: I733a178d838b4bd47adf6951c6a99993f1a74dd4
Closes-bug: #1624712

commit_message:
[newton] Only set NovaWorkers in the non-default case

This is a unclean backport of:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385078/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385058/

They can't be cherry-picked because of huge merge conflict, due to the
fact we're running Nova API in WSGI in master but not in Newton.

This backport is required to deploy TripleO on stable/newton.

Change-Id: I51814d319455686251c62cf197fa0b20fc014511

commit_message:
Add option to be able to run_functests.sh in parallel

Running the functional tests is time consuming.  This patch adds the
option `-j <job count>` to the tests/run_functests.sh: when given the
test run in parallel up the <job count> jobs.
When using this, be sure to have enough resources (CPUs, RAM and HD
space) on the host.

In addition there was the need to change two things:
o Global /tmp/dib-test-should-fail was move to temporary build
  directory of each execution.
o Because the logs might now interleave, each log line has now a
  prefix of the name of the testcase.

[In my environment running functests sequential takes 15+ minutes,
running them parallel takes less than 6 minutes.]

Change-Id: Id9ea5131f0026c292ca6453ba2c80fe12c47f808
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/65/345065/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function log_with_prefix { local pr=$1 while read a; do echo "[$pr] $a" done } local dont_use_tmp=$3 local use_tmp_flag="" trap "rm -rf $dest_dir" EXIT if [ "${dont_use_tmp}" = "yes" ]; then use_tmp_flag="--no-tmpfs" fi break_cmd="cp -v \$TMP_MOUNT_PATH/tmp/dib-test-should-fail ${dest_dir} || true" \ $DIB_CMD -x -t tar,qcow2 ${use_tmp_flag} -o $dest_dir/image -n $element $test_element 2>&1 \ | log_with_prefix "${element}/${test_element}"; then if [ -f "${dest_dir}/dib-test-should-fail" ]; then $DIB_CMD -x -o $dest_dir/image $element $test_element \ | log_with_prefix "${element}/${test_element}"; thenPARALLEL_EXEC="no" while getopts ":hlp" opt; do echo " -p : run all tests in parallel" p) echo "Running parallel" PARALLEL_EXEC="yes" ;;function wait_and_exit_on_failure { local pid=$1 wait ${pid} result=$? if [ "${result}" -ne 0 ]; then exit ${result} fi return 0 } PIDS="" run_${element_type}_element_test $test_element $element ${PARALLEL_EXEC} & PID=$! if [ "${PARALLEL_EXEC}" = "no" ] ; then wait_and_exit_on_failure ${PID} else PIDS+=" ${PID}" fi# Need to get the results one by one exit_code=0 for pid in ${PIDS}; do wait ${pid} result=$? if [ "${result}" -ne 0 ]; then exit_code=1 fi done if [ "${exit_code}" -eq 0 ]; then echo "Tests passed!" exit 0 else echo "At least one test failed" exit 1 fi
deleted_lines: trap "rm -rf $dest_dir /tmp/dib-test-should-fail" EXIT break_cmd="cp \$TMP_MOUNT_PATH/tmp/dib-test-should-fail /tmp/ 2>&1 > /dev/null || true" \ $DIB_CMD -x -t tar,qcow2 -o $dest_dir/image -n $element $test_element; then if [ -f "/tmp/dib-test-should-fail" ]; then $DIB_CMD -x -o $dest_dir/image $element $test_element; thenwhile getopts ":hl" opt; do run_${element_type}_element_test $test_element $elementecho "Tests passed!"

commit_message:
Add "Contributing Is Our Currency" to principles doc

This commit adds a new principle to the principles doc titled
contributing is our currency. The goal here is to express that while
we have a hierarchical leadership structure the only way change gets
implemented is by people actually contributing and doing the work.

Change-Id: I876f95ccbbf71f4f512275af110690888449e093
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/10/382110/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Contribution Is Our Currency ---------------------------- The way change is implemented in OpenStack is by someone stepping up and doing the work. While there is a hierarchical elected leadership structure, change is not implemented in a top down approach. The real work is done by people stepping up and contributing. Contribution is the mechanism for making change happen and it is also how trust is built between community members.

commit_message:
Ensure no-binary list translates to CLI options properly

The --no-binary CLI option needs to be provided multiple
times - one for each package. A comma-delimited list does
not work.

This patch ensures that the options are provided properly.

Change-Id: I2ef206a93e82f0510289a17db98500af85029f88

commit_message:
Fix migration-start id-dependent form

Share migration migration-start form was requiring the IDs
to be inputted for the new_share_type and new_share_network
fields. The main problem was finding the ID for the share type.

This fix redesigns the form to include dropdown lists instead of
text fields, allowing the share type and share network to be
selected from a list instead of having to input their IDs.

(cherry picked from commit bced12d63f3bac6c423a5b9c847910fc61c21039)
Closes-bug: #1626780

Change-Id: Iad45fa9fbec8c61b3f212d1e6f564c51c079aa15

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 12:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/fix_existing_wsgi_conf_from_packaging-f407b04e30ee44e2.yaml', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/barbican_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican/commit/25f2899ef866253face0cdd51604951b135fb52e', 'message': 'Manage package created apache config file

The Ubuntu Cloud Archive barbican-api package deposits a config file in
/etc/apache2/conf-enable, and then enables it. This configuration has a
duplicate definition for the WSGI process that is used by puppet. This
will cause apache to not start, or reload. The new behavior is to modify
the package deposited file of the new file names, as a comment like done
with the puppet-horizon package. RedHat family was added for parity.

Change-Id: I5c857a342000d04fe87c314c12bded78975d0c97
Closes-Bug: 1633850

commit_message:
Manage package created apache config file

The Ubuntu Cloud Archive barbican-api package deposits a config file in
/etc/apache2/conf-enable, and then enables it. This configuration has a
duplicate definition for the WSGI process that is used by puppet. This
will cause apache to not start, or reload. The new behavior is to modify
the package deposited file of the new file names, as a comment like done
with the puppet-horizon package. RedHat family was added for parity.

Change-Id: I5c857a342000d04fe87c314c12bded78975d0c97
Closes-Bug: 1633850
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/27/387027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Remove explicit service_name setting from nova manifest

We can now get this parameter from t-h-t, so it's not needed here.

commit_message:
Set nova service_name via t-h-t

with the move to use httpd instead of eventlet, We now add this
parameter in t-h-t to be able to clean it up from the puppet-tripleo
manifest.

commit_message:
Fix api_extensions_path in neutron-opencontrail environment

There is a missing repositiry for LBaaS in api_extensions_path in neutron-opencontrail.
This patch is working in my lab : tripleo liberty and opencontrail 3.0.2

Closes-Bug: #1634120

Change-Id: Ie06612faf226d0e5e75f3f8a9b560118cba5ff4c
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Modify the constraint to allow single quote for DPDK core list param

DPDK core list has to be give a string. For multiple cores, it
be given as "'1,2'". But the constraint does not allow ' (single
quote) to be set in the string. Modifying the constraint pattern.
Closes-Bug: #1633433

Depends-On: I01bf15b3c689b4fd0cdd848cf264dd9794e1d828
Change-Id: Ide2194d9ef5c10e276fa1a634919dfb286e483d6
(cherry picked from commit 1884d2a01c3fae195439918df2a1ea3f201b8893)

commit_message:
Pin pycparser

The pycparser project once again released a broken wheel, so we
need to pin it. Unfortunately, we can not just pin it in
requirements.txt because cffi is pulling it in via a different
mechanism.

More details in: https://github.com/eliben/pycparser/issues/151

Change-Id: Ie834f8afd057007e697edc608003eae4f071958d

commit_message:
Replace "LOG.exception(_" with "LOG.exception(_LE"

Follow http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html:
If a common message is not being used, they should each betreated
separately with respect to choosing a marker function.So this patch
is to fix it.

Change-Id: Ifae7746cbfdfdf747ef842e6b2bb640f4fd2fd10
Closes-Bug: #1600788

deleted_lines: LOG.exception(_("Skip loading extension for %s") % ep.name) LOG.exception(_('Unable to discover resources: %s') % err)

commit_message:
Properly use constraints

OpenStack CI is fixed now, we can remove these extra install commands.

Change-Id: Ice5518cd12ff8d09fa7fc7fca886a4ac729cc24b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/46/388146/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: [testenv:func_base] # NOTE(odyssey4me): this target does not use constraints because # it doesn't work in OpenStack-CI yet. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -c https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt {opts} {packages} # NOTE(odyssey4me): this target does not use constraints because # it doesn't work in OpenStack-CI yet. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = {[testenv:func_base]install_command}

commit_message:
wrong accumulative value of metric "network.services.lb.total.connections"

According to the wiki[1], the total.connections in the LBaaS response
should be a total number. Ceilometer should not accumulate the data again.

[1]https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron/LBaaS/API#List_Traffic_
Statistics_of_a_pool

Change-Id: I96318dc2d12f8c0888ec704b8710d2ab1cdb08f4
Closes-bug: 1561895

commit_message:
Update role SHAs for 14.0.0 2016-10-18

Also, the novnc SHA pin is reverted to resolve
console issues that have been identified. See
the related bug for details.

Related-Bug: #1633094

commit_message:
bracketer event transformer

Partial implements event bracketer transformer, now support
transformation of compute events only.

Transformer configuration in event_pipeline.yaml is:
transformers:
  - name: event_bracketer
    parameters:
      events:
        - event_type: compute.instance.create.start
        - event_type: compute.instance.create.end
      target:
        event_type: latency_time
        traits:
          - name: latency_time
            type: 2
            value: $compute.instance.create.end(generated) -
                                $compute.instance.create.start(generated)
          - name: instance_id
            type: 1
            value: $compute.instance.create.end(trait:instance_id)

Change-Id: I9638cc79e512706cf6cdad1d1f8d9cfc6f229c19
Partial-Implements: blueprint events-pipeline-transformers

commit_message:
Load a directory of YAML event config files

Load a directory of *.yaml event definitions files.
It will sort the list of file alphabetically and select the first
file as the base file. Every other file will extend into the base
configuration. If the configuration data structure is a list, then
the configuration of the other files extend the list. If the data
structure is a dictionary then the additional configuration data is
merged.

commit_message:
Add a docstring about workload_partitioning for notification agent

We don't have a detailed description of coordination process. Let's
start with a docstring

Change-Id: I22b88849eef2d16f3a88d5e408385b76c4ec7db8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/95/197295/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """Start Notification service. There are two main actions that should be done during service start: 1. Configure how data will be processed and published 2. Configure what to listen for data There are two managers responsible for processing: pipe_manager and event_pipe_manager. In the case without workload_partitioning these managers are PipelineManagers. With workload_partitioning enabled each of these managers contains a list of transporters. Each transporter is specific for a pipe and knows what counter_names are supported for a pipe and what notifier should be used for publishing, i.e. what topic should be used during IPC. When we publish data through *_pipe_manager we iterate through all transporters and decide whether the data should be sent to pipe-related topic or not. When running multiple agents we need to configure two batches of listeners: listeners for the main queue and pipeline_listeners for inner queue. After receiving from the main queue messages are processed by corresponding endpoints (they are loaded from setup.cfg ceilometer.notifications space using stevedore). All of them are subclasses of NotificationBase, so they have a manager which knows how to publish to IPC queue. After receiving from inner queue messages are processed with only one endpoint: EventPipelineEndpoint or SamplePipelineEndpoint. """

Use keystoneauth

Keystoneauth was extracted from keystoneclient.  This CR replaces usage
of keystoneclient in favor of keystoneauth.

Co-Authored-By: Clenimar Filemon <clenimar@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

commit_message:
Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Idfd8e3f4fe91df7d70e8c35a491c076b0b8f2348

commit_message:
Adding kubetoolbox image

This PS adds kubetoolbox image which is required for Kubernetes
fencing pod. This image includes, kubectl binary, ceph-common and ipmi.

Change-Id: I17b2a47b95ed7dea391f1427a41c92b15c97986d
Partially-Implements: blueprint kubernetes-toolbox
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/88/384988/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM {{ namespace }}/{{ image_prefix }}base:{{ tag }} MAINTAINER {{ maintainer }} {% block kubetoolbox_header %}{% endblock %} {% import "macros.j2" as macros with context %} {% if base_distro in ['centos', 'fedora', 'oraclelinux', 'rhel'] %} {% set kubetoolbox_packages = [ 'wget', 'jq', 'ceph-common', 'ipmitool' ] %} {% elif base_distro in ['ubuntu', 'debian'] %} {% set kubetoolbox_packages = [ 'wget', 'jq', 'ceph-common', 'ipmitool' ] %} {% endif %} {{ macros.install_packages(kubetoolbox_packages | customizable("packages")) }} RUN wget -O /usr/bin/kubectl http://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-release/release/v1.4.0/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl RUN chmod uog+x /usr/bin/kubectl {% block kubetoolbox_footer %}{% endblock %} {% block footer %}{% endblock %} {{ include_footer }}

commit_message:
Remove backend dependencies from token provider

The token provider module (core) has a list of methods that are called
by backend modules. This patch moves those methods to the backend and
removes dependencies where backend code references code in the core.

Change-Id: I59dab2efc5b743508ee9ecebcdc7c07b9f66791d
Closes-Bug: #1563101

added_lines: def base64_encode(s): """Encode a URL-safe string. :type s: six.text_type :rtype: six.text_type """ # urlsafe_b64encode() returns six.binary_type so need to convert to # six.text_type, might as well do it before stripping. return base64.urlsafe_b64encode(s).decode('utf-8').rstrip('=') def random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes(s): """Convert a string from :func:`random_urlsafe_str()` to six.binary_type. :type s: six.text_type :rtype: six.binary_type """ # urlsafe_b64decode() requires str, unicode isn't accepted. s = str(s) # restore the padding (==) at the end of the string return base64.urlsafe_b64decode(s + '==') b_audit_ids = list(map(random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(base64_encode, payload[3])) b_audit_ids = list(map(random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(base64_encode, payload[4])) b_audit_ids = list(map(random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(base64_encode, payload[4])) b_audit_ids = list(map(random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(base64_encode, payload[4])) b_audit_ids = list(map(random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(base64_encode, payload[6])) b_audit_ids = list(map(random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(base64_encode, payload[7])) b_audit_ids = list(map(random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(base64_encode, payload[5]))
deleted_lines: from keystone.token import provider b_audit_ids = list(map(provider.random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(provider.base64_encode, payload[3])) b_audit_ids = list(map(provider.random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(provider.base64_encode, payload[4])) b_audit_ids = list(map(provider.random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(provider.base64_encode, payload[4])) b_audit_ids = list(map(provider.random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(provider.base64_encode, payload[4])) b_audit_ids = list(map(provider.random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(provider.base64_encode, payload[6])) b_audit_ids = list(map(provider.random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(provider.base64_encode, payload[7])) b_audit_ids = list(map(provider.random_urlsafe_str_to_bytes, audit_ids = list(map(provider.base64_encode, payload[5]))

subject: Fix the KeyError in neutron-ovn-db-sync-util
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 14:41:00.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/cmd/neutron_ovn_db_sync_util.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/7ea5f61c18694a4deab18e1e13cb20c0970a424b', 'message': "Fix the KeyError in neutron-ovn-db-sync-util

cfg.CONF.ml2.mechanism_drivers = ['ovn-sync'] is not getting reflected
globally. Instead using cfg.CONF.set_override to override the value in
the neutron-ovn-db-sync-util.

Change-Id: I0444dfb53f112cd5c7d0a590d92b6ad101701380
Closes-bug: #1632971
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the KeyError in neutron-ovn-db-sync-util

cfg.CONF.ml2.mechanism_drivers = ['ovn-sync'] is not getting reflected
globally. Instead using cfg.CONF.set_override to override the value in
the neutron-ovn-db-sync-util.

Change-Id: I0444dfb53f112cd5c7d0a590d92b6ad101701380
Closes-bug: #1632971
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/16/386016/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

be created.

commit_message:
Support native OVN DHCPv6

For v6 subnets, the 'DHCP_Options.options' in the OVN NB DB were set to empty.
This patch now sets this column for v6 subnets and also sets the
'Logical_Switch_Ports.dhcpv6_options' appropriately. If extra DHCPv6 options
are defined for a port, a new row in DHCP_Options table is created just like
the way it is done for DHCPv4.

Beside 'enable_dhcp' attribute check to a subnet, for v6 subnets, we will also
check its 'ipv6_address_mode', to make sure v6 subnets with 'slaac' as
'ipv6_address_mode' attribute value will have no DHCP_Options rows for them
be created.

Co-authored-by: Zongkai LI <lzklibj@cn.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I9cf5a7ef7676c4461c05d6cb2aabbcb95b20f4d7

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I477eaf74541c65ad7ab54fa8c2412c8b9c74c684

This code will fix the broken code and avoid exception.

commit_message:
Update barbican for Debian based systems

There are barbican packages available for debian based systems
but the current module is designed to work with redhat based
systems only right now.

Change-Id: I4ab2e6ecf6626f4c647299eeec3cd5b3d3fbdaa9
(cherry picked from commit d1764c670a10f56bb61e85d92e65e34e2c5837c0)

commit_message:
Partitioner - Rety on failure to get members

Zone Manager, maybe 1 in 1000 startups, can fail to
fetch the list of group members. This appears to be
a hard to prove race condition. Adding a basic retry
mechanism to avoid this.

Change-Id: Ic15297ea08c1aedcec0f6fd39f8863e426003c1f

subject: Add __ne__ built-in function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-16 01:16:27.000000000', 'files': ['designate_tempest_plugin/common/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/commit/4f173f37d616a7fbfe2e747208400565e4fe1648', 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I5abcaa9d74712df591499e8334f1d627b2d7d1ca
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as
expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I5abcaa9d74712df591499e8334f1d627b2d7d1ca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin refs/changes/84/386984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other) def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(...,None)

Change-Id: I52f6acc8b53c7d1378d989580f7d24b3a2fc6cfc

commit_message:
Do not ignore_errors for fallback keyserver

The initial keyserver usage should ignore errors so that
the fallback keyserver can be used. However the second
task should not ignore errors as there is no third
keyserver - if the first has failed, and the fallback has
failed, then the task should fail and the installation
should stop.

Change-Id: I60fdbbde70f9bb14cfdf57e4c357f1cd0fc24f55
(cherry picked from commit 31a623021891a8ff1ea67c878496812ee2a8e096)

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/45/388145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Currently, the Monasca role for OSA does not configure any of the services in HA. Installation of the monasca-agent into hosts and containers is also not handled.Most modern monitoring systems have the ability to cluster its database for resiliency and present the user interface in a highly available fashion. The Monasca role as currently defined only launches single hosts with the supporting services configured as single hosts. If you wanted to put the monasca-api behind a VIP, you would have three different apis with disparate information. There is currently no monasca-agent OSA role defined. To get monasca-agent on a OSA installation, you have to manually install it, or use the ansible-monasca-agent playbook to install it into hosts and containers after the fact. * Not clustered, but for HA to work correctly on Grafana, session sharing and configuration database connection must be set to the OSA Galera cluster * The os_monasca-agent role must be developed to install the agent onto all hosts during the pre-install * Improvements must be made to monasca-agent to correctly identify all servicesOnly alternative is using another monitoring system if you plan on using OSA, or living with the eventual doom of your monitoring data.If the user does not include the os_monasca role, there will be no impact other than the inclusion of the python-monascaclient into the utility containers. If included, the user will likely have to add a few configuration options, like VIP ranges, replication factors, things that related solely to monitoring and data resiliency.Monasca & friends work independently from OSA so no impact to the openstack upgrade process is expected. If the containers are trashed during the upgrade, monasca-agent will have to be re-installed. If not, monasca-reconfigure script will have to be ran to discover changes to hosts/containers. * Only sensitive item the playbook would need would be the admin password to enroll the monasca users & endpoints. * Yes but only on the dedicated Monasca hosts to install & configure services. Monasca-agent install does not require escalation.
deleted_lines: Currently, the Monasca role for OSA does not configure any of the services in HA. Installation of the monasca-agent into hosts and containers is also not handled.Most modern monitoring systems have the ability to cluster its database for resiliency and present the user interface in a highly available fashion. The Monasca role as currently defined only launches single hosts with the supporting services configured as single hosts. If you wanted to put the monasca-api behind a VIP, you would have three different apis with disparate information. There is currently no monasca-agent OSA role defined. To get monasca-agent on a OSA installation, you have to manually install it, or use the ansible-monasca-agent playbook to install it into hosts and containers after the fact. * Not clustered, but for HA to work correctly on Grafana, session sharing and configuration database connection must be set to the OSA Galera cluster * The os_monasca-agent role must be developed to install the agent onto all hosts during the pre-install * Improvements must be made to monasca-agent to correctly identify all servicesOnly alternative is using another monitoring system if you plan on using OSA, or living with the eventual doom of your monitoring data.If the user does not include the os_monasca role, there will be no impact other than the inclusion of the python-monascaclient into the utility containers. If included, the user will likely have to add a few configuration options, like VIP ranges, replication factors, things that related solely to monitoring and data resiliency.Monasca & friends work independently from OSA so no impact to the openstack upgrade process is expected. If the containers are trashed during the upgrade, monasca-agent will have to be re-installed. If not, monasca-reconfigure script will have to be ran to discover changes to hosts/containers. * Only sensitive item the playbook would need would be the admin password to enroll the monasca users & endpoints. * Yes but only on the dedicated Monasca hosts to install & configure services. Monasca-agent install does not require escalation.

commit_message:
Add upper constraints prep to ansible-role-jobs

Currently the UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE environment variable
is set, but there is no file. This patch ensures that the
file is on the test node too.

Change-Id: I34af5505e9f3f1744134428f03e96d3446e5c2a0

commit_message:
Replace yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Bandit flags yaml.load() as security risk so replace all occurrences
with yaml.safe_load()

Change-Id: I8d0b322b9083c63a75bc34caf2a67fc05d8a4390
Closes-Bug: #1634265

commit_message:
Run configure src before install for API charms

When a charm uses the default install hook the charms installation
source is not configured. This means a charm installs the default
packages for the Ubuntu release then detects an upgrade is available
and upgrades all the packages instead of just deploying the correct
packages straight away

Change-Id: I79bdd04ada4cf6e52728c1acae69823401451ac2
Closes-Bug: 1634564

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Ibfdbd879bd407c85b11fe61787113419eca0c250
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_magnum refs/changes/25/388125/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import openstackdocsthemeimport os 'oslosphinx', 'sphinxmark'html_theme = 'openstackdocs'html_theme_path = [openstackdocstheme.get_html_theme_path()] watermark = os.popen("git branch --contains $(git rev-parse HEAD)\ | awk -F/ '/stable/ {print $2}'").read().strip(' \n\t').capitalize() if watermark == "": watermark = "Pre-release" # -- Options for sphinxmark ----------------------------------------------- sphinxmark_enable = True sphinxmark_div = 'docs-body' sphinxmark_image = 'text' sphinxmark_text = watermark sphinxmark_text_color = (128, 128, 128) sphinxmark_text_size = 70

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following

subject: Make divisible py3 compatible in remotefs driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-19 06:53:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7af502ed65efbfb660e008dccacd6ad209706003', 'message': "Make divisible py3 compatible in remotefs driver

the code:
import platform
print('Python', platform.python_version())
print('3 / 2 =', 3 / 2)
print('3 // 2 =', 3 // 2)
print('3 / 2.0 =', 3 / 2.0)
print('3 // 2.0 =', 3 // 2.0)

in py2
('Python', '2.7.10')
('3 / 2 =', 1)
('3 // 2 =', 1)
('3 / 2.0 =', 1.5)
('3 // 2.0 =', 1.0)

in py3
Python 3.4.3+
3 / 2 = 1.5
3 // 2 = 1
3 / 2.0 = 1.5
3 // 2.0 = 1.0

So it need to modify the code to adapt to this difference.

Change-Id: I6811f849ffcd2aaa4a6fefc8ce864097b447cf5f
Closes-Bug: #1596139

commit_message:
Make divisible py3 compatible in remotefs driver

the code:
import platform
print('Python', platform.python_version())
print('3 / 2 =', 3 / 2)
print('3 // 2 =', 3 // 2)
print('3 / 2.0 =', 3 / 2.0)
print('3 // 2.0 =', 3 // 2.0)

in py2
('Python', '2.7.10')
('3 / 2 =', 1)
('3 // 2 =', 1)
('3 / 2.0 =', 1.5)
('3 // 2.0 =', 1.0)

in py3
Python 3.4.3+
3 / 2 = 1.5
3 // 2 = 1
3 / 2.0 = 1.5
3 // 2.0 = 1.0

So it need to modify the code to adapt to this difference.

Change-Id: I6811f849ffcd2aaa4a6fefc8ce864097b447cf5f
Closes-Bug: #1596139
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/53/372253/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: block_count = size * units.Gi / (block_size_mb * units.Mi) virt_size = data.virtual_size / units.Gi

commit_message:
Showing the metadata readonly value as a separate field

Now, cinder show <volume_id>, shows readonly as a separate field. This
helps the user to not have to scan all through the volume's metadata
field

Change-Id: Ib427f7e76e8e28fee97b75413c3032fbee75af86
Closes-bug: #1307098
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/80/332480/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if info['metadata'] is not None: data = info['metadata'] if 'readonly' in data: info['readonly'] = data['readonly']

commit_message:
Help msg and output info should support il8n.

Help msg and output info should support il8n.
And delete the unused import six.

Close-Bug: #1629157
Change-Id: Ie1faf0a83ec5f04dc6c8303f1ea0c931ba482e2a

Add diskimage-builder repos to shade dsvm jobs

They were recently removed from the base devstack-gate PROJECTS but are
needed if heat is enabled. Add them.

commit_message:
Add a new validation step to OneView drivers

The OneView driver needs to manage the boot order
of the Server Profile so that it can deploy instances
on the machine. The driver currently does not validate
if the Server Profile Template used in the node allows
it. This patch is about to add this validation and
ensure the driver can manage the boot order.

Change-Id: If81e10ec9da97382e36a75e42966e3c3f46ef9c7
Depends-On: Ie65731a38061171627e7a0786efc083a5518085a
Closes-Bug: 1628117

commit_message:
Create a consolidated API test

For historical reasons we split out tests into five seperate tests.
Since we are now using these for API testing we can now consolidate
these into one test.

Change-Id: Icb45c6d5043e6e3c79a332b084ff725432b79d4e

commit_message:
Add Gentoo support to nodepool

This commit adds Gentoo support to elements needed to build a Gentoo
nodepool image.  The previous version of this commit had the default
section of the pkg-map in the wrong area, specifically in the following
file.

nodepool/elements/infra-package-needs/pkg-map

Change-Id: Ic686c325bc06564585a2e3ac50cadd7556612333
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/14/387114/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $DISTRO_NAME == gentoo ]]; then GRUB_CFG=/boot/grub/grub.cfg else GRUB_CFG=/boot/grub2/grub.cfg fi /usr/sbin/grub2-mkconfig -o "${GRUB_CFG}"

commit_message:
Add opensuse-minimal element

Add a new opensuse-minimal element to build small and highly
configurable openSUSE based images using the zypper-minimal element
as the main building mechanism

commit_message:
Add zypper-minimal element

Add a new zypper-minimal element to bootstrap SUSE-based distributions

Change-Id: Id63397e412a929d61247cfd3d9f8d4e758c1248a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/75/381575/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2016 SUSE Linux Products Gmb # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # if [ "${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0}" -gt 0 ]; then set -x fi set -eu set -o pipefail [ -n "${ZYPPER_REPOS}" ] function cleanup() { sudo umount $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/var/cache/zypp } trap cleanup EXIT ZYPPER_TARGET_OPTS="--non-interactive --gpg-auto-import-keys --root $TARGET_ROOT" ZYPPER_INSTALL_OPTS="--no-confirm --no-recommends" for repo in ${ZYPPER_REPOS}; do reponame=repo-${repo%%=>*} repouri=${repo##*=>} sudo zypper ${ZYPPER_TARGET_OPTS} addrepo --name ${reponame} --keep-packages ${repouri} ${reponame} done # Refresh it sudo zypper ${ZYPPER_TARGET_OPTS} refresh # It appears that zypper will clean up the repo's cache when it (re-)adds the # repo so we need to add the cache now, once the repos are added. This is # similar to what the zypper/50-zypper-cache script does ZYPPER_CACHE_DIR=$DIB_IMAGE_CACHE/zypper mkdir -p $ZYPPER_CACHE_DIR sudo mkdir -p $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/var/cache/zypp sudo mount --bind $ZYPPER_CACHE_DIR $TMP_MOUNT_PATH/var/cache/zypp # Install filesystem, base and useful tools sudo zypper ${ZYPPER_TARGET_OPTS} install ${ZYPPER_INSTALL_OPTS} filesystem # Install basic components in order sudo zypper ${ZYPPER_TARGET_OPTS} install ${ZYPPER_INSTALL_OPTS} -t pattern base # Install a few useful tools sudo zypper ${ZYPPER_TARGET_OPTS} install ${ZYPPER_INSTALL_OPTS} python zypper # Put in a dummy /etc/resolv.conf over the temporary one we used # to bootstrap. systemd has a bug/feature [1] that it will assume # you want systemd-networkd as the network manager and create a # broken symlink to /run/... if the base image doesn't have one. # This broken link confuses things like dhclient. # [1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1197204 echo -e "# This file intentionally left blank\n" | \ sudo tee $TARGET_ROOT/etc/resolv.conf # set the most reliable UTF-8 locale echo -e 'LANG="en_US.UTF-8"' | \ sudo tee $TARGET_ROOT/etc/locale.conf # default to UTC sudo -E chroot $TARGET_ROOT ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/UTC \ /etc/localtime # RPM doesn't know whether files have been changed since install # At this point though, we know for certain that we have changed no # config files, so anything marked .rpmnew is just a bug. for newfile in $(sudo find $TARGET_ROOT -type f -name '*rpmnew') ; do sudo mv $newfile $(echo $newfile | sed 's/.rpmnew$//') done # Unmounting of the /var/cache/zypp is handled by the cleanup EXIT # handler so there is nothing else to do here

commit_message:
Add ability to set upper constraints file

When this role executes the installation of packages
for SNI support it should also respect upper constraints.

This patch adds the ability to set an upper constraint
file URL/path.

The tox config is also adjusted to ensure that it makes
use of upper constraints when installing requirements.

Change-Id: I2ab6f55096b560a7b443de412df168e26a3eca07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/72/388072/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The URL/path of a constraints file to use when installing the additional pip packages. #pip_install_upper_constraints: "http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt"

add VfilePatternEx to apt-cacher-ng for centos.

the pattern to match the url.

commit_message:
Fix keystone fernet file exchange via ssh

* install openssh client in keystone-fernet container
* install rsync in keystone-ssh container
* fix syntax issue in ssh configuration
* copy ssh configuration into keystone-fernet container
* copy id_rsa.pub into keystone-ssh container
* copy id_rsa into keystone-fernet container
* use full path to ssh binary in used scripts
* add missing newlines at EOF
* when using type source set /var/lib/keystone as home
  directory for the user keystone

Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Zhang <jeffrey.zhang@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: Id6b41030056a69f6516a054beb2fc0e08226e876
Closes-bug: #1623013
(cherry picked from commit bedca5b35e8f9336182d5588d5650c1bb0682702)
